Description: Two bands of tapestry applied and sewn to an undyed, plain weave linen textile; the larger band on the upper part, has a central medallion, the bust of a female with curly, brown hair, wearing a diadem, ear-rings and pearls, she wears a colourful dress and a yellow halo, in her left hand she holds a stylised object (fruit and flowers basket?) and in her right hand a heart-shaped/flower-shaped motif; the medallion is surrounded by floral and vegetal interlacing with leaves; on each side of the centre are naked, putti swimming or flying all orientated towards the female figure, they hold quadrupeds (goats?); under the goat legs are human heads and behind each putti is a stylised Greek vase with vegetal motifs springing from them; on each side the putti are separted by interlacing with leaves on a dark blue background; the entire tapestry is framed above and below with a freize of multi-coloured geometric motifs; 3cm under the large tapetry is another band of tapestry with a purple background, framed by two freizes of geometric motifs and showing stylised animals (bird, quadrupeds) and stylised intelacing that creates half a lozenge; the plain weave is cut and ragged, but there is a hem on each side indicating that the plain weave was folded and each side joined together to make the edge of a sleeve of a tunic; plain weave: warp-undyed linen (S/14), weft-undyed linen (S/11); lager tapestry on grouped threads: warp-undyed linen (2 threads S plied/12), weft-undyed linen (S), yellow, orange, pink, red, light blue, dark blue, green wool (S/red is 48); smaller band of tapestry on grouped threads: warp-undyed linen (S spun Z ply/14), weft-purple, red, mauve, light green, green, dark blue, yellow wool and undyed linen (S/some paired/36); oversewing threads in undyed linen (S spun Z ply); all edges are cut
Curator's comments: includes a small bag with threads and fibres inscribed 'loose threads removed during cleaning'
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
